name: Colonoscopy Benefits - Medical
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. A colonoscopy done for a medical reason by a Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) will be covered and subject to your <$> copay, <$> deductible for the year, <percent> coinsurance and <$> out-of-pocket maximum for the year. After your out-of-pocket maximum is met, Wellmark will cover remaining costs at 100 percent of the maximum allowable fee. If your colonoscopy is performed with general anesthesia rather than sedation, it may not be a covered benefit unless there is a medical reason requiring the provider to use general anesthesia. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Colonoscopy Benefits - Preventive
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, if the colonoscopy is part of a routine visit at an in-network provider, you will not be responsible for any coinsurance or deductible. If the colonoscopy is received for medical reasons other than a routine exam, you will be responsible for a deductible of <amount>, copay of <<amount>> and coinsurance of <amount>, which will go toward your out of pocket maximum for the year of <amount>. For colonoscopies that are part of preventive service visits, insurance will cover conscious sedation. Your health care provider will be able to tell you if the service is for routine or medical reasons. If you see an out-of-network provider, you may be responsible for greater out-of-pocket costs. The easiest way to make sure your provider is in-network is to use the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Covered Service
subject: Benefits

You would be responsible for a deductible of <<amount>>, copay of <<amount>> and coinsurance of <<amount>> if you see an in-network provider. This will go toward your out-of-pocket maximum amount for the year of <amount>. To see a list of in-network providers, check the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: CPAP
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) treatment and supplies are covered under your health plan benefits. According to your plan benefits, you will be responsible for a deductible of <<amount>>, copay of <<amount>> and coinsurance of <<amount>>, which will go toward your out of pocket maximum for the year of <amount>. Your CPAP may be billed over 10 months as a rental and at the end of the 10 months it is considered purchased. Your machine must be purchased from a licensed durable medical equipment provider. Wellmark has two preferred suppliers: Edge Park and Better Living Now. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Diabetic Education
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, diabetic education is a covered service. Training or education is covered when it is: â€¢ Prescribed by a licensed physician â€¢ Provided by a state-certified program â€¢ Covered by at least 10 hours of outpatient diabetes self-management training â€¢ Provided within a 12-month period. You will be responsible for a deductible of <<amount>>, copay of <amount>> and coinsurance of <<amount>>, which will go toward your out of pocket maximum for the year of <amount>. It's important to know, however, that nutritional counseling with a dietitian or nutritionist outside of diabetes education is not a covered benefit. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Mental Health
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, outpatient mental health care is covered. You would be responsible for a deductible of <<amount>>, copay of <<amount>> and coinsurance of <<amount>> if you see an in-network provider. This will go toward your out-of-pocket maximum amount for the year <amount>. To see a list of in-network providers, check the Find a Provider tool. There are some services that are not covered under your health plan such as: â€¢ Applied behavior analysis (ABA) services for the treatment of autism and related disorders â€¢ Bereavement counseling â€¢ Non-pervasive developmental and learning disorders â€¢ Certain disorders of early childhood, such as academic underachievement disorder â€¢ Communication disorders â€¢ Impulse control disorders â€¢ Marriage or family counseling â€¢ Services of volunteers or clergy. As always, talk to your doctor about the best options for your personal situation. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Office Service Deductible
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your deductible. The <$> copay on your policy applies to the exam only. Any additional office services you receive are subject to your <$ deductible amount> deductible followed by <percent coinsurance> coinsurance. The service will also go towards your <OOP amount> out-of-pocket maximum for the year. Please see below for definitions of these health care terms. Copay: The fixed dollar amount you pay at the time of getting care. Deductible: The amount you pay before your plan starts to pay. Coinsurance: Your share of the costs of a covered health care service, calculated as a percent. Out-of-pocket maximum: The most you will pay during a policy period (usually a year) before your health insurance or plan begins to pay 100 percent of the allowed amount. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

subject: Benefits
content: Dear <Name>, Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Telehealth and telemedicine services are used to deliver care from a distance. You will be responsible for a <amount> copay. Telemedicine occurs when doctors communicate with each other to treat a patient. Your doctor may send images, X-rays or other information to another health care provider or specialist to assist in treatment. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your Wellmark ID card. Sincerely, Wellmark Customer Service

subject: All Subjects
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Your inquiry is currently being researched. We appreciate your patience, and will provide additional information once our research is complete. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: 3D Mammograms â€“ Covered
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your coverage. Wellmark evaluates new technologies extensively, including 3D mammography. We're happy to inform you that 3D mammograms are covered under your plan as a preventive service if they are done by an in-network provider. The easiest way to make sure your provider is in-network is to use the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark, located under the Find Care tab. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: 3D Mammograms â€“ Not covered
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your coverage. 3D mammograms are not currently covered under your plan. You are still able to get a 2D mammogram, which would be covered. If you decide to get a 3D mammogram regardless of your coverage, your provider needs to bill the service separately in order for Wellmark to cover the 2D portion of your mammogram. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: 3D Mammograms â€“ Not covered, no cost share for 2D
displayName: 3D Mammograms â€“ Not covered, no cost share for 2D
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your coverage. 3D mammograms are not currently covered under your plan. You are still able to get a 2D mammogram, which would be covered with no cost share to you if it is done by an in-network provider. If your mammogram is a follow-up or diagnostic mammogram, it will apply towards your plan's deductible, copay, coinsurance and out-of-pocket maximum. If you decide to get a 3D mammogram regardless of your coverage, your provider needs to bill the service separately in order for Wellmark to cover the 2D portion of your mammogram. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: 3D Mammograms-no cost share
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your mammography benefits. You are covered for routine mammograms (including 3D) with no cost share to you if they are done by an in-network provider. If your mammogram is a follow-up or diagnostic mammogram, it will apply towards your plan's deductible, copay, coinsurance and out-of-pocket maximum. The easiest way to make sure your provider is in-network is to use the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark, located under the Find Care tab. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Bariatric Surgery
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your benefits, bariatric surgery and related treatments are covered under your health plan if you receive prior approval from Wellmark. Your surgeon will need to submit the request to us. If you receive approval and use an in-network provider, you will be responsible for the deductible, copay, coinsurance, and the out-of-pocket maximum associated with your plan. To view your plan's details, including deductibles and coinsurance amounts, visit the Coverage tab in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Bariatric Surgery - Not Covered
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, bariatric surgery and related treatments are not covered under your health plan. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Breast Pump â€“ Grandfathered
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Breast pumps are a covered benefit under your policy every two years. They are subject to your plan's deductible and coinsurance up to your annual out-of-pocket maximum. Wellmark allows electronic pumps to be rented or purchased. Manual pumps are only allowed to be purchased. To view your plan's details, visit the Coverage tab in myWellmark. Wellmark requires a prescription on any durable medical equipment (DME), including breast pumps, that's billed to us even if the item can be purchased without a prescription. The breast pump may be purchased at any time either before or after delivery. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Breast Pump - Non-Grandfathered
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Breast pumps are a covered benefit under your policy every two years. Wellmark requires a prescription on any durable medical equipment (DME), including breast pumps, that's billed to us even if the item can be purchased without a prescription. A DME supplier must have the prescription for the item on file, and your practitioner may also be asked for it by Wellmark. The breast pump may be purchased at any time either before or after delivery. Wellmark will waive the cost share for manual breast pumps and standard electric breast pumps purchased from an accredited DME provider (must be in-network or participating). You can locate accredited DME providers using the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark. Wellmark does not include hospital-grade breast pumps in the cost-share waiver. Wellmark allows electronic and manual pumps to be rented or purchased. The hospital-grade breast pumps are subject to your annual deductible and coinsurance. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Cologuard Benefits
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Cologuard is covered if it is ordered by an in-network doctor and processed by an in-network lab. Exact Sciences is the primary lab providing test results for Cologuard and is in-network with Wellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Medicare Supplement
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. In general, your Medicare Supplement policy through Wellmark pays only for services approved by Medicare. Please contact Medicare at 1-800-633-4227 for more information regarding your benefits. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Medicare Supplement Hearing Aids
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Please contact Medicare at 1-800-633-4227 for more information regarding your benefits. In the event that Medicare does not reimburse for hearing aids, Wellmark provides a discount program where you may find a price reduction for hearing aids. You can browse these discounts and more online at Wellmark.com/Blue365. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Newborn Mandate FBHP
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Your policy does not have coverage for a newborn unless they are added to the plan. To add your newborn without underwriting, contact your agent within 30 days of birth. If you have any additional questions, please contact your agent.

name: Newborn Mandate ON Exchange
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Your policy does not have coverage for a newborn unless they are added to the plan. To add your newborn, contact the Marketplace at 1-800-318-2596. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Physical Routine
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your benefits, your health plan covers one preventive physical exam per benefit period (usually a calendar year). It's important to know, however, that some tests not covered for routine visits, like; Urinalysis, complete blood count, chest X-ray, electrocardiogram, plus others. If these tests are needed for a medical diagnosis, your deductible, coinsurance or copay amounts may apply. If youâ€™re unsure if a test is for routine or medical reasons, you can ask your doctor. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Physicals 365 Days Not Required
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your policy. Your policy allows for one preventive physical exam and an additional gynecological exam per benefit period. The benefit period is per calendar year and does not require 365 days between physicals. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. According to your health plan benefits, you do not need a referral or approval before choosing to see a specialist. There are some cases, however, where a specialist requires a referral from your doctor. As always, check to see if the specialist you plan on seeing is in your health planâ€™s network of providers by checking the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

EFT can be set up on a monthly, quarterly, semi-annual or annual basis. Direct Bill can only be set up for semi-annual or annual payments. If you need to update your bank account information or enroll in EFT, go to the billing section found under the My Plans tab in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

If you need to update your bank account information or enroll in EFT, please go to the billing section found under the My Plans tab in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

subject: Claims

name: Flex Benefit-Wage Works
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about your flexible benefits. Our Flex Benefit Customer Service Department would be happy to help you with your question. You can contact them by phone at 1-877-924-3967.

name: Global Core: Worldwide
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. When youâ€™re travelling outside the United States, you have access to doctors and hospitals in more than 200 countries and territories around the world through the Blue Cross Blue Shield Global CoreÂ® Program. Here are some helpful tips to keep in mind before and during your travel: 1. Verify your international benefits with Wellmark before leaving the United States by calling the Customer Service number on your member ID card. Your benefits may be different when you are outside the country. 2. Always carry your member ID card. In an emergency, go directly to the nearest doctor or hospital, then call Blue Cross Blue Shield Global Core. 3. For non-emergency inpatient medical care, you must call Blue Cross Blue Shield Global Core first. The Service Center can arrange access to a hospital, provide information on doctors and give you information about payment. Toll-free: 1-800-810-2583 Collect: 1-804-673-1177 (Blue Cross Blue Shield Global CoreÂ®) 4. When pre-certification/pre-authorization is required, call Blue Cross Blue Shield Global Core. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: HIPAA Privacy Guidelines
subject: All Subjects
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) ensures your personal health information is kept private. Wellmark takes protecting your personal information very seriously, which is why policyholders can only access information about their own claims and general financial information about the covered dependents on their plan. Dependents over the age of 18 can access detailed information about their own claims after creating their myWellmark account at myWellmark.com. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Blue RX (Part D)
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. It appears you may have some questions regarding MedicareBlueSM Rx (PDP). To make sure you get answers to your questions, youâ€™ll need to contact their specific customer service line at 1-888-832-0075 or call the number on your MedicareBlue Rx ID card.

name: Not Needing a PCP Medicare
subject: Benefits
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about designating a personal doctor. Selecting a primary care physician is not required with a Medicare supplement policy. All services covered by Medicare are covered by your Medicare supplement policy through Wellmark as long as you see providers that accept Medicare. To see a list of covered services, view the Coverage tab in myWellmark. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Open Enrollment Medicare
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about Medicare Open Enrollment. As a current Wellmark member, you do not have to do anything to renew your coverage for next year. As long as you continue to pay your premium, your policy will stay active. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Adding a Dependent FBHP
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about adding your dependent/spouse. To determine if they can be added, please contact your agent. As a reminder, newborns must be added within 30 days of birth to avoid underwriting. If you have additional questions, please contact your agent.

name: Adding a Dependent IFP- Not Exchange
displayName: Adding a Dependent IFP- Not Exchange
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about adding your dependent. A dependent can only be added to a policy with a qualifying event. To determine if you have a qualifying event, please go to wellmark.com/i-buy-my-own/life-events and review the eligible events. If your event qualifies, please complete the Contract Change form. You must submit the form within 60 days of the event for your dependent to qualify for coverage. If you don't have a qualifying event or aren't within the 60-day timeframe, your dependent will not be eligible to be added to your contract. If you have additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Blues Enroll (Step Group)
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. We appreciate you taking the time to notify us of the change in your information. Because this information is managed by your policyholderâ€™s employer, you will need to contact their Human Resources office to update this information. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Cancellation - Direct Bill
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. We can take a cancellation request through myWellmark or over the phone. This action will cancel your policy the first of the month following the receipt of the request. Any unused payments will be refunded to you in the form of a check and will be issued within 30 days. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Cancellation - EFT
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. We can take a cancellation request through myWellmark or over the phone. This action will cancel your policy the first of the month following the receipt of the request. We will need to receive your request before the tenth of the month in order to guarantee we can stop an automatic bank draft. If the draft takes place, we will refund the money back to you in the form of a check within 45 days. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Cancellation - Written
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Cancellation of your policy requires a written request with your name, member ID number, a statement advising that you wish to cancel and your signature. Please also include documentation of other coverage for review to allow your coverage to be termed retroactive. The letter can be faxed to 515-376-9045 or mailed to: Wellmark Blue Cross and Blue Shield, Station 3W190 P.O. Box 14527 Des Moines, IA 50306-3527. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Change-ON Exchange

We recommend that you talk to an agent to see if you have any other options. If you do not have an agent, you can find one by visiting Wellmark.com/AgentFinder. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

You can expect to receive your new ID cards in about seven to 10 business days. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: PCP Change
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. Changing your designated personal doctor is simple. Just submit another web inquiry letting us know which member on the policy the change applies to along with the doctorâ€™s name, address and enrollment ID number. To find the doctorâ€™s enrollment ID number or to see a list of available personal doctors in your network, use the Find a Provider tool in myWellmark. You can also call Wellmark Customer Service at the phone number on your ID card to change your personal doctor over the phone.

name: Removing a Dependent
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about removing a dependent/spouse from your policy. Please complete the Contract Change form to remove the dependent/spouse. The cancellation date will be the first of the month following your signature date on the contract change form. Policies can be retroactively canceled to match the effective date of a dependent's new coverage if one of the following is true: they're on a Medicaid policy or if they're on another Wellmark or Blue Cross Blue Shield policy. Please note, the contract change form must be received within 90 days of the effective date of the other coverage to allow the retroactive cancellation. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Removing a Policyholder
subject: Membership
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark about removing the policyholder from your policy. There must be a qualifying event to remove the policyholder from your policy. Please complete the Contract Change form within 60 days from the date of the event. The effective date of the removal will be the first of the month following your event. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Costs
subject: Pharmacy
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. We know that changing costs can have a real impact on you and your family. While drug costs are largely influenced by external factors such as price increases from manufacturers or a higher number of people taking prescription drugs, Wellmark is committed to helping keep drug costs affordable for all members. One of the simplest ways to make sure youâ€™re being a smart consumer is to talk to your doctor. Many times, generic alternatives are available that are proven to be just as safe and effective but cost less. Your doctor can also help you determine other options that may be available to you to keep your pharmacy costs as low as possible. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Formulary
subject: Pharmacy
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. A formulary helps guide physicians and pharmacists in choosing medications for you that provide the right treatment for the best price. You can review your formulary drug list on myWellmark under the Coverage tab to see what drugs are or are not covered based on your plan benefits, as your health plan may not cover all medications. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. To protect the privacy of your personal health information, we're unable to give out this information via web inquiry. To view your prescription drug information, click on the Coverage tab in myWellmark and look in the Pharmacy section. Here, you can visit the CVS/Caremark page under the Resources section. You'll need to register as a new user to view your information if you haven't already done so. Dependents over the age of 18 can access their own information by logging in to their myWellmark account at myWellmark.com. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call Customer Service at the phone number on your member ID card.

name: Value of Wellmark
subject: All Subjects
content: Thank you for contacting Wellmark. There are many reasons why Wellmark is the right choice for your health insurance needs. As an Iowa & South Dakota-based mutual insurance company owned by its policyholders, we work hard to minimize premium changes and make decisions in your best interest. But most importantly, our overall focus is on improving the health of the communities and people we serve. If you have any additional questions, please feel free to submit another question or call customer service at the phone number on your member ID card.

Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy and Speech Therapy were consolidated into a single visit when performed on the same date of service. This message code does not require a review of medical records as this will not result in a different payment. You can view more information about EAPGs under the â€œClaimsâ€ tab. name: EAPG payment methodology
subject: Claims
content: Thanks for contacting Wellmark. Claim lines that have been processed with following line messages should not be resubmitted with medical records. M376/F76: Procedure packaged due to consolidation of same significant procedure or clinically significant procedure. M377/F77: Denied because this is a packaged item with no significant procedure, medical visit, ancillary, or per diem service on the same day. M379/F77: This procedure was packaged as it is considered part of a Significant Procedure, Medical Visit, Ancillary or Per Diem Service. These line messages represent consolidation and packaging within the EAPG payment methodology. You can view more information about EAPGs under the â€œClaimsâ€ tab. If you have any questions, please reply to this message or submit another question. Sincerely, Wellmark Customer Service
